This vile Ingratitude made her Sin so heinous in GOD'S sight. When Mercy is despised, Wrath is ex∣asperated: Sins committed after signal Deliverances, are exceedingly aggravated. Ezra 9.13, 14.— Seeing that thou our God hast given us such Deliverance as this, should we again break thy Commandments? The gracious GOD hath sent the chief of those Angels which he sent to Sodom, the glorious increated Angel, the Lord Jesus Christ into the World, to deliver us from the everlasting Burnings of Hell: Let us not imi∣tate Lot's Wife in despising this great Mercy.
THUS we should remember and improve the Sin of Lot's Wife.
II. WE shou'd remember the PUNISHMENT of Lot's Wife: the terrible Judgment which GOD inflicted upon her.

THIS is recorded for our Admonition, Gen. 19.26. She became a Pillar of Salt. When she looked back, she was struck dead upon the spot, and was turned into a Pillar of Salt. By her becoming a Pillar of Salt, some I think, understand no more than her being made a lasting Monument of GOD'S severe Justice; as a perpe∣tual Covenant is stiled a Covenant of Salt, Num. 18.19. But why the literal Sense of the words should be rejec∣ted, I can see no Reason; but do believe that she was really turned into a Pillar, a Statue of Salt, a kind of rocky, mineral Salt, which will endure all Weathers and not waste away. Naturalists write of Salt which is hard enough for Buildings.— Josephus, who lived since Christ was on Earth, saith that the Pillar of Salt was standing in his Time, and that He himself had seen it. And the like is affirmed by others since his time. — We are now call'd to look upon it with the Eyes of our Minds.
1. WE shou'd remember the Punishment of Lot's Wife, because it represents to us the evil Nature, and infinite Demerit of Sin.

LOT's Wives Punishment was severe & dreadful, yet it did not exceed the desert of her Crime, for look∣ing back upon Sodom, she was turned into a Pillar of Salt.—By this we may learn, That there is more Evil
in every Sin, than Men are aware of: It is more dis∣pleasing to the holy GOD than we can imagine it to be: GOD'S Thot's of Sin are not as Man's; his ac∣count of it and Man's are very different. The Infi∣nite Being against whom Sin is committed, and who only knows the Malignity & Demerit of it, does not make light of the smallest Sin. The Wages of every Sin is Death. And the righteous GOD, to shew his Hatred of Sin, and what a heavy Punishment it de∣serves, sometimes in this World remarkably executes Vengeance upon Men, for those Faults, which to a common Eye appear small & inconsiderable. He that turned Lot's Wife into a Pillar of Salt, for looking back on Sodom, struck Uzzah dead, for touching the Ark; and smote the Men of Bethshemesh Fifty Thou∣sand, threescore and ten, for looking into it. Behold therefore the severity of God: on them which fell severity, Rom. 11.22.— Jer. 2.19. Know therefore and see, that it is an evil thing and bitter, that thou hast forsaken the Lord thy God, and that my fear is not in thee, saith the Lord God of hosts.— On the Pillar of Salt is engraven the Desert & Doom of every Sinner amongst us, and He that runs may read it. Lot's Wife is thus set forth for an Example, shewing to us what we deserve for our Rebellion, Atheism, Unbelief, Covetousness, and Contempt of GOD'S Mercy. Was Lot's Wife a greater Sinner than You, or I? They are not always the greatest offenders, on whom GOD inflicts the most visible Judgments in this World, See Luk. 13.1, 2, 3, &c. We shou'd look upon the Pillar of Salt, that our Flesh may tremble for fear of GOD, and that we may be afraid of his Judg∣ments. The Desert of Sin is still the same, and GOD is immutably and impartially Just; what he hath done to others, he may do to us. It is certain, that unless our Repentance prevent, GOD'S Wrath will fall upon us, if not in such a manner, yet as terribly as it did upon Lot's Wife: and as it will be more tolerable for Sodom & Gomorrah, so it will for Lot's Wife in the Day of Judgment, than for us, if we continue to neg∣lect & despise the great Mercy of GOD in sending his
Angel, the Lord JESUS, to deliver us from the Lake that burns with Fire & Brimstone.
2. WE shou'd remember the Punishment of Lot's Wife, and be convinced of the Folly and Danger of sinning in Secret.

SHE looked back from behind Lot, so that he could not observe and reprove her; but she was before GOD, did that Evil in His sight, and He rebuk'd her in His Anger. GOD'S Judgments will sooner or later find Men out in their most secret Sins, Zeph. 1.12. I will search Jerusalem with candles, and punish the men that are settled on their lees; that say in their heart, the Lord will not do good, neither will he do evil. There is no darkness, nor shadow of Death, in which the workers of Iniquity can hide themselves from his Eyes, which are as a flame of Fire. If we are Religious & Pray in Secret, our gracious Father in Hea∣ven will reward us openly: But if we are Wicked, and Sin in Secret, our righteous Judge will punish us openly; if not in this World, yet sadly in that which is to come. Wo unto their Soul, who declare their Sin as Sodom, and hide it not: Wo also unto theirs, who conceal their Sin as Lot's Wife, for GOD will reveal it, and reckon with them for it.
3. WE shou'd remember Lot's Wive's Punishment, and not desire, nor delight in the forbidden Society of vicious Persons, lest we be involved in their Ruin.

LOT's Wife lingered in, and look'd back upon Sodom, wishing (most probably) that she might en∣joy the Company of her Friends & Acquaintance there; and therefore she suffer'd with them. GOD's exemplary Vengeance was poured down on her at the same time, that it was on them; and it is probable in the same manner. Fire & Brimstone might be rained on her, as well as on them. A judicious Divine thus expounds that Text, Gen. 19.24. The Lord rained upon Sodom and upon Gomorrah, brimstone & fire; that is, He consumed them by Thunder & Lightning. Which (saith he) some of the Pagans had notice of, for Taci∣tus tells us, that those Cities were set on fire and burnt up by the stroke of Thunder. He adds, The
Saline Pillar which Lot's Wife was turned into, was probably the Effect of this wonderful Meteor; for from several Examples it appears, that Persons struck with Thunder have continued in the same Posture wherein they were when they were alive, and their dead Bodies are stiffned by the sulphurious Va∣pours penetrating them. But whether Lot's Wife was struck dead with a flash of that Fire which burned Sodom or not, yet she was destroyed with that wicked People; and as Sodom was turned into a Lake, Heaps and Pits of Salt Gen. 14.3. Deut 29.23. Zeph. 2.9., so Lot's, Wife was turned into a Pillar of Salt. She partook of the same Curse. This is a Warning to us, not to hanker after the forbidden Society of lewd & wicked Persons, lest we be destroyed with them. If we have fellowship with the unfruitful Works of Darkness, we shall be led forth with the Workers of Iniquity. If our Life be now among the Unclean, we may expect soon to have our part with them in the Lake which burneth with Fire & Brim∣stone, Rev. 18.4. I heard another voice from Heaven, saying, Come out of her, my People, that ye be not partakers of her sins, and that ye receive not of her plagues.
4. WE shou'd remember the Punishment of Lot's Wife, that sudden Destruction from GOD may be a Terror to us.

WHEN Lot's Wife looked back, she immediately became a Pillar of Salt: She was struck dead in a moment. This instance of GOD'S Wrath shou'd make us sensible how obnoxious we are to sudden Destructi∣on. The Long-suffering of GOD waited upon Lot's Wife, while she lingred in Sodom; but when she looked back, his Wrath made quick work. GOD hath exer∣cis'd great Patience toward us, yet he may bring swift Destruction upon us, Isa. 42.13, 14. The Lord shall go forth as a mighty man, he shall stir up jealousy like a man of war: he shall cry, yea, roar; he shall pre∣vail against his Enemies. I have a long time held my peace, I have been still & refrained my self, now will
I cry like a travailing woman, I will destroy and devour at once. While we are in our Sins, we have no Security, no, not for one moment, from the destroy∣ing Judgments of GOD. Vengeance which hath been hitherto delayed, may overtake and surprize us in the next Act of Sin. If we proceed a step further in an evil Course, our feet may stumble, and we fall head-long into Perdition. We shou'd remember Lot's Wife, and other Examples of sudden Destruction, and stand on , and nor sin. Let Unclean Persons remember Zimri & Cozbi, on whom vengeance was executed in the very Act of their Uncleanness, Numb. 25.8. When any one is tempted to that wickedness, let him think of the Dart that striketh thro' the Liver, Prov. 7.23. Let proud & arrogant Sinners remember Herod, whom the Angel of the Lord smote immediately, Acts 12.23. Let Riotous & Profane Persons remember Belshazzar, who was slain in that Night, when his Heart was merry with Wine, and no Vessels but those of the Sanctuary wou'd serve him for a drunken Fro∣lick, Dan. 5. — Luk. 21.34. Take heed to your selves, lest at any time your hearts be over-charged with surfeiting and drunkenness, and the cares of this Life, and so that day come upon you unawares. Let all careless, sensual and worldly Wretches remember the Sinners of the old World, and of Sodom, who gave up themselves wholly to their secular Business and car¦nal Delights, till the Flood and the fiery Storm came and destroyed them all. Let us not put the evil Day far from us. "The Prophet gives us the Alarm like one that awakens a Family with the cry of Fire, Fire," Zeph. 1.14. The great day of the Lord is near, it is near, and hasteth greatly. Peals of Warning are now sounded in our Ears both from the Word and the Pro∣vidence of GOD, and if our stupid Hearts are not moved with fear, and we do not flee from Wrath, we may look for sudden & inevitable Destruction, Prov. 29.1. He that being often reproved, hardneth his neck, shall suddenly be destroyed, and that without re∣medy.
5. WE shou'd remember the Judgment inflicted on Lot's Wife, and fear lest we bring on our selves a strange Punishment.

THIS was a strange Punishment, a Woman turned into a Pillar of Salt. Not only the suddenness, but also the strangeness of a Punishment is to be dreaded. The common Calamities of Mankind are apt to be look'd upon by too many, as the Effects of natural Causes only, or to be ascrib'd to Fortune: GOD there∣fore sometimes goes out of the beaten Road of his Ju∣dicial Dispensations, and inflicts some rare, extraordi∣nary Judgment, to awaken the drowsy World to take notice of his Hand. Numb. 16.29, 30, 31. If these men die the common death of all men, or if they be visited after the visitation of all men, then the Lord hath not sent me. But if the Lord make a new thing, and the Earth open her mouth, and swallow them up, with all that appertain unto them, and they go down quick into the Pit: then ye shall understand that these men have provoked the Lord. And it came to pass as he had made an end of speaking all these words, that the ground clave asunder that was under them: and the Earth opened her mouth & swallowed them up. We should fear and tremble, lest GOD should visit us with some such unusual Judgment, Job 31.3. Is not destruction to the wicked? and a strange punish∣ment to the workers of iniquity? Destruction will certainly be their Portion, unless they Repent, and it may be brought upon them in some extraordinary and dreadful manner, Isa. 28.21. The Lord shall rise up as in mount Perazim, he shall be wroth as in the val∣ley of Gibeon, that he may do his work, his strange work; and bring to pass his act his strange act.
6. WE shou'd remember the Punishment of Lot's Wife, and be deterred from Sin by the Shame which is the Fruit of it.

IT was a disgraceful Punishment that Lot's Wife suffered. The Pillar of Salt into which she was turned was a lasting Memorial of her Sin & Folly, and perpe∣tuates her Shame. Men always dishonour GOD by sinning against him; and sometimes in punishing of
them in this World he sets a mark of peculiar Infamy upon them, and causeth their Sins to be remembred to their Disgrace in after-Ages. His Judgments in∣flicted upon them are monumental Pillars, on which their Sins are written to their great reproach and perpetual shame. Some Punishments are like Pillars of Salt, not to keep Sinners Names from stinking in the nostrils of Posterity, but to preserve the Memory of them to their everlasting Disgrace. In some Exe∣cutions of divine Justice, GOD doth, as it were hang up Malefactors in Chains, and make them "Specta∣cles of public Shame". Ezek. 5.14, 15. I will make thee a reproach among the Nations that are round about thee, in the sight of all that pass by. So it shall be a reproach and a taunt, an instruction and an astonishment unto the Nations that are round about thee, when I shall execute Judgments in thee in anger, and in fury, and in furious rebukes.
THUS in the Judgment inflicted on Lot's Wife, there is much Instruction & Warning given unto us. It may therefore be very profitable for us to remember her Punishment.
HAVING spoken thus distinctly, first, Of the Sin, and secondly, Of the Punishment of Lot's Wife, and shown how we should remember & improve each of them,— I would under a third general Head,
III. CONSIDER them TOGETHER, and show what the Instruction & Warning is, which they jointly afford us: and it is this, viz. That in our flight from mystical Sodom, we should not look back.

THIS is the chief & comprehensive Benefit design'd us by the great Lover of our Souls, in calling upon us to remember Lot's Wife, namely, That we might be deter'd from looking back, when we are flying from Wrath. CHRIST said to his Disciples, In that Day (meaning the day of GOD'S vengeance against Jerusa∣lem) let not him that is in the field turn back. Re∣member Lot's Wife. As if he had said, You must
flee out of Jerusalem with all possible speed, and beware lest you imitate Lot's Wife, who as she was escaping from Sodom looked back upon it, and for so doing was immediately turned into a Pillar of Salt. And what CHRIST said to them is applicable, and is now directed to us all in this solemn Memento and Caution,
REMEMBER Lot's Wife, and in your flight from spiritual Sodom take heed that ye look not back, lest ye also be Consumed.
THAT this Admonition may be set in a clear Light before our Understandings, and come with power on our Hearts and Consciences, and have a good Influ∣ence into our Behaviour, I wou'd observe to you,
I. THAT while Men are in the Corrupt State of Nature, they are mystically in Sodom.

THEY are in such a Condition as Sodom was an Emblem of. They are so both in respect of the gross Pollution which they are wallowing in, and the dread∣ful Destruction which they are exposed to. Sodom was a very polluted and dangerous Place; the State of Na∣ture is such a State: All that are in it, are in as deep Pollution and great Danger, as those who dwelt in Sodom. — Let this two-fold Resemblance betwixt Sodom and a State of Nature be consider'd by us,
1. UNCONVERTED Sinners may be fitly said to be in Sodom, in regard of that Pollution which they wallow in
SODOM was a Sink of moral Pollution, in which the People like Swine did wallow: and so it repre∣sented the Corrupt State of Nature, in which the Children of Men are altogether filthy.

IT is said, Gen. 13.13. That the Men of Sodom were wicked, and sinners before the Lord exceedingly. And this may be truly said of all that are in the State of Nature: Tho' they are not all in respect of actual Sins, so wicked as the Men of Sodom were, yet they are in respect of the habitual and Perverseness of their Nature. Original Sin is greater than all the
actual Abominations that were committed in Sodom. Sodom was a Sink, but corrupt Nature is a Foun∣tain of moral Defilements: And there is more filthy Water in this Fountain, than ever issued forth in the impure streams of Sodom. The Fountain did not cast out all it's dirty Waters, even in that so defiled Land. Altho' that People did draw iniquity with cords of vanity and sin as it were with a rope, yet they did not draw the Fountain dry. But as the Streams discover what the Fountain is, so the abomi∣nable Wickedness in Sodom, sheweth to us what the Corruption of our fallen Nature is. And those who are in the State of Polluted Nature, are in respect thereof more filthy & desperately wicked, than the People of Sodom, were in respect of the actual Abominations which prevailed in it. They dwell amidst greater Impurities, than those which were visible, and did openly abound in Sodom.

THERE is this remarkable difference between Sodom and a State of Nature; It was possible for a Man to be Righteous in the former, but it is not so in the latter. Indeed, there were not ten righteous Persons to be found in Sodom, when the LORD came down to see whether the People had done altogether according to the Cry that went up to him; yet there was One good Man that lived in it at that time; Just Lot, vexed, and so not corrupted, with the filthy conversation of the wicked there: For that righteous man dwelling among them, in seeing and hearing, vexed his righte∣ous soul from day to day with their unlawful deeds, 2 Pet. 2.7, 8. It was possible, tho' very difficult for one to live in Sodom, and not be infected with the Sins of that Place; but it is impossible for one to abide in the State of Nature, and to be free from the Pol∣lutions of it, Job 15.14. What is man that he should be clean? and he which is born of a woman, that he should be righteous? It is impossible for him to be so, till he is born of GOD, and there be a Change of his Heart and State.

THUS in respect of original Corruption, and actual Abominations, Sinners, wherever they dwell on the face of the Earth, are the people of Sodom. In a spiritual sense they live in Sodom. GOD may justly say concerning all who are in the State of polluted Na∣ture, as in Jer. 23.14. They are all of them unto me as Sodom, and the Inhabitants thereof as Gomorrah.
2. ALL unconverted Sinners may be fitly said to be in Sodom, in respect of that Destruction to which, they are expos'd.

THE State of Nature is like Sodom, not only in re∣gard of the Pollution but also of the Punishment of those who continue in it. GOD'S exemplary Venge∣ance on Sodom is mentioned in our Context, ver. 29. The same day that Lot went out of Sodom, it rained fire and brimstone from Heaven, and destroyed them all. Agreable to the Account given of it, Gen. 19. 24, 25. The Lord rained upon Sodom and upon Go∣morrah, brimstone and fire from the Lord out of Hea∣ven. And he overthrew those cities, and all the plain, and all the inhabitants of the cities. Now this was Emblematical of the utter Destruction of all those who finally remain in the State of Nature; so the Scriptures inform us, 2 Pet. 2.6. Turning the cities of Sodom and Gomorrah into ashes, condemned them with an overthrow, making them an ensample unto those that after should live ungodly. The Ruin of the People of Sodom sheweth to all who live ungodly, what they must expect, and what their End will cer∣tainly be, if they remain in a State of Nature, viz. to be burned. The Fire which consumed the Inhabitants of Sodom, was a Type of Hell-fire, which shall consume all the Adversaries of GOD, Jude v. 7. Even as Sodom and Gomorrah, and the cities about them in like man∣ner
giving themselves over to fornication, and going after strange flesh are set forth as an example, suffer∣ing the vengeance of eternal fire. The Fire which destroyed them is said to be Eternal, either because of the still continuing Effects of it, or rather, because it was a Type or Representation of the Fire of Hell, and to those miserable Sodomites the very beginning of it, they being brought by those temporal Flames into everlasting Burnings Pool's Annot.. The terrible Destruction of the Sinners in Sodom, by Fire and Brimstone, was a lively Representation of the sad and eternal Ruin of all impenitent Sinners. Upon the wicked God shall rain snares, fire and brimstone, and an horrible tem∣pest: this shall be the portion 'of their cup. The Heavens and the Earth which are now, by the same Word which created them, are kept in store, reser∣ved unto fire, against the day of Judgment, and perdition of ungodly men. — Then shall the King, the righteous Judge, say unto them on the left hand, Depart from me, ye Cursed, into everlasting fire. And they shall be cast into a lake of fire, burning with brimstone. Thus, as the Inhabitants of Sodom were all destroyed by Fire and Brimstone, so the Scriptures speak of the final Destruction of all impe∣nitent Sinners, as that which shall be by Fire & Brim∣stone, whether properly or metaphorically, I shall not dispute: But only say, that if we take these Scrip∣tures in a figurative sense, they represent the Pains of the Damned to be at least as exquisite & intolerable, as those which Fire and Brimstone can produce. How did the poor tormented Wretches in Sodom run scream∣ing about, when showers of flaming Brimstone came down upon them, and their Bodies were so many blazing Torches! Alas, How then will miserable Sinners roar out, gnash their Teeth, and gnaw their Tongues for Pain and Anguish, when they shall be thrown into the Lake that burns with Fire and Brim∣stone, which is the second Death, far worse than the first! — Now let Sinners in Zion (who are also
in spiritual Sodom) be afraid, let take hold on Hypocrites; for who among shall dwell with the devouring Fire? Who amongst us shall dwell with everlasting Burnings?
THUS we see in what respects the State of Nature may be spiritually called Sodom.
Obs. II. THAT the Children of Men are warned to Flee out of spiritual Sodom.

LOT's Wife, and others in Sodom, were fore-warned of the burning Tempest which GOD would rain upon it, and were compassionately advis'd & urg'd to get out of Sodom, that they might not be involv'd in it's overthrow. GOD sent Angels from Heaven, to give them notice of the approaching Ruin: yea, the Messenger of the Covenant was sent on this Errand. Those Ministers of GOD called upon Lot, his Wife and Daughters, to make haste, and get out of the accursed City; And while they lingered in Sodom, being; loth to leave their commodious Dwelling, rich Estate, and worldly Conveniencies, the Angels laid hold on their hands, and brought them forth, and set them without the City and charged them to escape for their Lives, and not to stay in all the Plain, but to escape to the Mountain, Gen. 19. In like manner the gracious GOD deals with the Children of Men, who are in spiritual Sodom. He warns them to get out of the polluted, dangerous Estate of Nature: He sends his Ministers, the Angels of the Churches, who cry aloud, and shew unto Sinners their Danger, Duty and In∣terest; calling earnestly upon them to forsake their Sins, and part with all which is inconsistent with the Safety and Salvation of their Souls: yea, the glorious increated Angel doth by the Ministry of the Word come, and warn Sinners to escape out of mystical Sodom. 2 Cor. 5.20. Now then we are Ambassa∣dors for Christ, as though God did beseech you by us: we pray you in Christ's stead, Be ye reconciled to God▪— By awakning Dispensations of his Providence, and strong Convictions of his Spirit, the LORD doth, as it were, lay hold on the hands of lingring Sinners,
and pull them out of Sodom; making them leave off the practice of their gross Abominations, and to use some Endeavours to reform their Lives, and save their Soul.— Thus graciously is the Long-suffering GOD pleas'd to warn those who are in spiritual Sodom, to hasten out of it, and flee to the City of Refuge, which he hath appointed and prepared for them, lest they be consumed with his fiery Indignation, which he will pour out on all who remain in the corrupt and ac∣cursed State of Nature. Matth. 3.7. O Generation of vipers, who hath you to flee from the wrath to come?— When the GOD of Hosts is coming forth in his Judgments against his Enemies, he observes that Law of Arms which he gave the Israelites; which was, to offer Terms of Peace to a City before they assaulted it, Deut. 20.10. When thou comest nigh unto a city to fight against it, then proclaim peace unto it. So the LORD, who is a Man of War, sounds a Parly with the Trumpet of his Word, and monitory Pro∣vidences, before he dischargeth the Cannons of his de∣stroying Judgments: He Summons his Enemies to a Treaty of Peace, [Prepare to meet thy God O Israel] before he falls on them with the Artillery of his Ven∣geance. He gives Notice to Sinners of their approach∣ing Ruin, that so by their Repentance they might prevent it, Jer. 18.11. Thus saith the Lord, Behold, I frame evil against you, and devise a device against you: return ye now every one from his evil way, and make your ways, and your doings good — Hear now the word of the Lord, ye men of Sodom; Give ear, Ye people of Gomorrah, all that are in the pollu∣ted dangerous Estate of Nature: — Wash ye, make you clean, put away the evil of your doings from before mine eyes, cease to do evil, learn to do well— Come now and let us reason together, saith the Lord: Tho' your sins be as scarlet, they shall be as white as snow; tho' they be red like crimson, they shall be as wool. If ye be willing and obedient, ye shall eat the good of the land: But if ye refuse and rebel, ye shall be devoured — O Earth, Earth, Earth, hear the word of the Lord: O less, stupid Sinners,
who mind earthly things, ye are again and again warned and intreated, to get out of spiritual Sodom, lest Fire and Brimstone be rained upon you. Zech. 2.6. Ho, ho, come forth, and flee from the land of the North, saith the Lord. Ye are now earnestly called upon, to come forth, and flee from the Land of the South, as well as from the Land of the North — from mystical Sodom, as well as Babylon. Will you still linger, when the Clouds of GOD'S Displeasure are visibly hanging over our Heads, ready to burst with Thunder and Lightning; and the Earth under us is sensibly heaving to vomit out Fire and Brim∣stone, to consume us? O Sinners, make haste, delay no longer to get out of the State of Nature, and to keep GOD'S Commandments.—Escape for your Lives, — the Lives of your precious Souls.— Escape to the Mountain, the Mountain of the LORD'S House:— Flee to CHRIST for Refuge.— Flee as Men pursued with the greatest Danger.— Flee with all possible speed — Yea, Flee like as they fled from before the Earthquake, in the days of Uzziah King of Judah.
LET me not seem to any of you, as Lot did to his Sons in Law, even as one that mocked.
Obs. III. THAT in their flight from spiritual Sodom, Persons are apt to look back.

LOT's Wife was brought without the City, and she fled with him and her Daughters a while toward Zoar, and was in a fair way to escape the Ruin, which was then coming on the People of Sodom; But she slacken'd her Pace, linger'd behind, and looked back. This Sin of Lot's Wife is imitated by many in their flight from spiritual Sodom: They are so far awaken'd and wro't upon, that they abandon their vicious Practices, and seem to be brought out of the State of polluted Nature; they turn their backs upon Sodom, and set their faces towards Zion, and are in a fair way to escape the wrath of GOD: they run well for a time; take considerable Pains in Religion, strive to enter in at the strait Gate of Repentance & Faith, labour to get
into CHRIST: perform holy Duties with much serious∣ness, and apply themselves to the Work of their Sal∣vation with fear and trembling; and they are not far from the Kingdom of GOD: But they do not hold on, their Heat is soon spent, and they flag: Their dread of GOD'S Wrath, and concern for their Souls abate; good Impressions wear off; and they meeting with Difficulties in the way of Salvation, grow weary of the Christian Race, stand still, and look back —. They are tempted to think, there is no need of so much Care about their Souls, that they were in no such Danger as they apprehended them to be; that the Fire & Brimstone which they were told of, and affrighted with, will not be rained upon them: The Love of the World and the things of it, revives in them; and they fancy it was never better with them, than when they were quiet and undisturb'd in the Enjoyment of their outward Comforts, and sensual Delights; and so thro' Unbelief, and Love of this World, they (as Lot's Wife did) look back with De∣sires of returning to their former Pleasures. The State of spiritual Pollution and Bondage appears not so bad to them, as when they were first awaken'd to get out of it; nay, better than that of Holiness, which they have been striving to get into: As the Israelites, in their Journey to Canaan, thought that it was better with them in Egypt, and said one to another; let us make us a captain, and let us return into Egypt, Numb. 14.4. — They who seem to have escaped out of spiritual Sodom, and to have made considerable Progress toward Zion, do not ordinarily go back at once, but by degrees. They first look back; they grow weary of Prayer, and other Duties, are less fre∣quent and fervent therein: They say, Behold, what a weariness is it? and they bring the torn, the lame and sick for an offering to the Lord; Their Minds hanker after their former Company and Delights: Temptations increase upon them daily, and they are more and more inclin'd to resume their abandon'd Lusts, and to renew their fellowship with the unfruitful Works of darkness. Having thus looked back, they
commonly (unless prevented by sudden Destruction) go back to Sodom; revert to their old Abominations. Prov. 26.11. As a Dog returneth to his vomit, so a Fool returneth to his folly. This is cited by the Apostle, and apply'd to the Apostates in his time, [O that it were not verified in many of us!] 2 Pet. 2.22. It is happened unto them according to the true Proverb, The Dog is turned to his own vomit, and the Sow that was washed to her wallowing in the mire.
Obs. IV. AWAKNED Sinners, in their flight from spiritual Sodom, should remember Lot's Wife, that so they may be deter'd from looking back.

PERSONS may imitate the Sin, and incur the Punish∣ment of Lot's Wife, tho' they do not attempt an Escape out of mystical Sodom: may be guilty of Disobedience, Contempt of GOD'S All-seeing Eye, of Unbelief, Covetousness and Ingratitude for the Mercy of GOD in offering to save them from the flames of Hell; and thereby may expose themselves to sudden and shame∣ful Destruction: But such as have begun their flight from spiritual Sodom, (as I hope, some here present have,) if they look back, they especially do imitate Lot's Wives Sin, and may expect as terrible a Punish∣ment as Her's: It is therefore peculiarly seasonable, and may be very profitable for those who are endea∣vouring to get out of spiritual Sodom, are sollicitously asking the way to Zion, with their faces thitherwards, and are flying from Wrath to come, to remember Lot's Wife. Look not behind you, lest ye be consumed— Will it not be as great a Sin in you, to look back, as it was in Lot's Wife? And may you not well be afraid of as great a Judgment, as that inflicted on her? If you look back, ye may become Pillars of Salt, Mo∣numents of GOD'S severe Justice, Spectacles of Shame and everlasting Reproach. If GOD doth not immedi∣ately consume you, he may righteously smite you with Judicial Hardness; seal you up to Ruin by final Ob∣duration, letting you stand a few Years more in this World, only as occasions to glorify his Power & Wrath
upon you in the next. Theophilact saith, Lot's Wife remain'd obstinate and impenitent, and her Heatt was hardned, and that this is the meaning of her being turned into a Pillar of Salt: Altho' his Interpretation of the Text is not to be embrac'd, yet it may be im∣prov'd by those who are in their flight from spiritual Sodom, to deter them from looking back, lest in his sense they become Pillars of hardned Salt.

Zeph. 1.6. I will stretch out my hand, and cut off them that are turned back. In the days of Josiah, wherein this Threatning was denounced, the sinful People of Judah were greatly awaken'd, & outwardly Reformed: But they soon revolted: Many that began well, set out with Zeal in the good ways of the Lord, turned and looked back: GOD threatned them parti∣cularly, that he would stretch out his hand, and cut them off, wou'd be quick and severe upon them. — Remember the words of CHRIST, Luk. 9.62. No man having put his hand to the plough, and looking back, is fit for the Kingdom of God. Go through with the work that ye have begun, or ye shall never enter into the Kingdom of God. Oh! Consider the Dan∣ger and Mischief of looking back. If ye return to your former Abominations, the unclean Spirit will have a stronger Possession of you, than he had before, Matth. 12.43, 44, 45. When the unclean Spirit is gone out of a man, he walketh thro' dry places, seeking rest, and findeth none. Then he saith, I will return into my house from whence I came out, and when he is come, he findeth it empty, swept, and garnished. Then goeth he, and taketh with himself seven other Spirits more wicked than himself, and they enter in and dwell there: and the last State of that man is worse than the first. This is well Expounded by the Apostle, 2 Pet. 2.20, 21. For if after they have escaped the pollutions of the world, thro' the knowledge of the Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ, they are again in∣tangled therein, and overcome; the latter end is worse with them than the beginning. For it had been bet∣ter for them not to have known the way of Righteous∣ness,
than after they have known it, to turn from the holy Commandment delivered unto them.

IF ye should be intangled again in your Lusts, and return to the Mire of your Sinful Pollutions, your Escape, if ever it be attempted by you, will be far more difficult than it was at first; your Deliverance out of Spiritual Sodom, will be almost despaired of.— Ye having begun in the Spirit, be not so foolish as to end in the flesh. — If any of you have slacken'd your pace, and are turning and drawing back, be convinc'd of your folly and danger, and quickned in your flight to CHRIST, by what ye now hear, — Gal. 5.7. Ye did run well, who did hinder you, that you should not obey the truth? — Renew your Resolutions against Sin, and for Holiness and Heaven: Lay aside every weight, and the Sin that doth so easily beset you, and run with patience and perseve∣rence the Race set before you: — and as ye run, Remember Lot's Wife.

LET such as are really brought forth out of spiri∣tual Sodom, and have fled for Refuge to lay hold on the Hope set before them, Remember Lot's Wife, to deter them also from looking back. Indeed, those who are escaped out of mystical Sodom, ought to look back thereon, with an admiring Eye at the infinite Mercy of GOD, in plucking them as Brands out of the Fire. They shou'd reflect on their former polluted and miserable Estate, to excite their Thank∣fulness unto GOD for delivering them out of it; laying hold on their hearts by his omnipotent Grace, when they lingred in spiritual Sodom, and effectually bringing them out of it. There is a looking back, which may serve to abase them, and exalt divine Grace, Isai. 51.1. Hearken to me, ye that follow af∣ter Righteousness, ye that seek the Lord: look unto the Rock whence ye are hewen, and to the hole of the pit whence ye are digged. But they must not
look back on spiritual Sodom with any Regret for their leaving it, nor desire of returning to it. — They are not, it's true, of them who draw back unto Per∣dition, Heb. 10.39. GOD'S electing Love, Cove∣nant-faithfulness, almighty Power, and CHRIST'S continual Intercession shall prevent the total Defection of the Saints. But they are prone to look back, and to go back also a considerable way toward Sodom. Declensions are very common among the sincere People of GOD. They frequently slacken their Pace in the good ways of the LORD; grow Cold in Re∣ligion, remiss in holy Duties, do abate much of their Zeal for GOD, and back-slide into many Sins. Altho' they shall not draw back unto eternal Perdition; yet they may to their spiritual Loss, and temporal De∣struction: They may provoke GOD to inflict such Judgments on them, as to make them Monuments of his righteous displeasure against the Sin of looking back. Dr. Edwards saith, Theol. ref. v. 1. p. 257. That it is not improba∣ble that Lot's Wife, who was turn'd into a Pillar of Salt, was saved notwithstanding this Judgment sent upon her by GOD. We have (saith he) no ill Cha∣racter of this Woman in the Scripture: [he might as truly have said, that we have no good one:] we cannot (saith he) gather from any thing that is said in the sacred History that she had been a wicked Per∣son: [neither can we that she had been a righteous Person:] But this we know, saith he, that she was the Consort of a pious Saint, and beloved of GOD: [we also know that a wicked Woman is sometimes the Wife of a godly Man:] And we know, saith he, that she was mercifully deliver'd out of Sodom, as well as her Husband: [so might Lot's Sons in Law have been, had they not laugh'd at the warning gi∣ven them.] Tho' I perceive not the strength of those Reasons which the Doctor gives, why it is not improbable that Lot's Wife was a good Woman, yet I am dispos'd to be of the most Charitable Opinion, if there are as probable Grounds to support it as the
contrary. And if she was a good Woman, the Pun∣ishment inflicted on her may the more deter the Saints from looking back: for it sheweth how the Jealous GOD resents this Sin in his own Children.— Let them remember Lot's Wife, and not imitate her Sin, but Paul's Example; Phil. 3.13, 14. Brethren, I count not my self to have apprehended, but this one thing I do, forgetting those things which are behind, and reaching forth unto those things which are be∣fore; I press toward the mark, for the Prize of the high calling of God in Christ Jesus. — Let them remember Lot's Wife, that so they may resist and vanquish all Temptations to Apostacy: and if they do so, they shall become glorious Pillars in the hea∣venly Temple, bearing the most honourable Inscrip∣tion; Rev. 3.12, 13. Him that overcometh, will I make a Pillar in the Temple of my God, and he shall go no more out: and I will write upon him the Name of my God, and the Name of the City of my God, which is new Jerusalem, which cometh down out of Heaven from my God; and I will write upon him my new Name.
HE THAT HATH AN EAR, LET HIM HEAR WHAT THE SPIRIT SAITH UNTO THE CHURCHES.

THUS I thought it meet to stir you up, by putting you in Remembrance of Lot's Wife. And if you are Careful to improve what hath been said, You shall find that that Pillar of Salt hath not to this day lost it's Savour; but that your Hearts are seasoned thereby with such Caution, and holy fear, as will be of un∣speakable & eternal Advantage to you: Wherefore, Be not forgetful Hearers, but Remember Lot's Wife.
